install.name: Grid2
install.author: Anthony Olsen
install.description: The Zen Grid template is a base skeleton template for you to build your joomla theme with. Please refer to documentation on the Joomla Bamboo site for full documentation.

param.name: backgroundOptions
param.label: Use a preset theme configuration or customise using the options below?
param.description: Set this to yes to use the options for styling the background below.

param.name: @desc
param.default: The options below are enabled if you select preset in the option above. You can select the colour hilite to use on your site. Should you want to create your own your hilite the css file should be uploaded to the templates/css/[your template name]/hilite folder.

param.name: @desc
param.default: The following options determine the settings for the various visual elements in this theme. If you do not want to use the options below simply set the first option to no. Or if you would like to specify the background colour without an image set the background image option to none selected.

param.name: custombackgroundContrast
param.label: are you using a light or a dark background?
param.description: This option is designed to change the colour of the links and text that are directly on the background eg breadcrumb or footer links. Because you have a lot of control over the way that the background appears in this theme you may need to use this setting in order to view text published in positions that are not ditting in the top nav area or the main area. If you would prefer to control the colour of these areas yourself simply set this option to override and control the colour of these areas via your hilite file selected in the settings above.

If you change the logo folder used to source your logo image please make sure that you hit apply in order to load the new image files in the logo image dropdownlist.
The dropdownlist that contains the images that are available for the logo will not refresh until you do this.

Please note that the width assigned to the logo position needs to balance according it's position. eg If assigned to the same row as the nav then the logo width needs to take the width assigned to the menu in the nav settings.

If any of the module positions in this row arent published then the value assigned to them does not count. The following settings change the text for the open and close button for the drop panel. In order for the button to appear you need to make sure that at least one module is published to the panel1, panel2, panel3 or panel4 positions.

If you would like to disable the panel then make sure there are no modules published to these positions.

param.name: @desc
param.default:
The following group of settings contain some tweaks to the performance of your template.

The css compression setting determines whether you compress the output of the Zen Grid core and Joomla system css files. Enabling this setting can significantly the load time and http requests for css files on your site.

The setting to remove mootools must be used cautiously and only if you do not operate or need the mootools library to load on the frontend of your site.

param.name: csscompress
param.label: Compress System and core css files?
param.description: Select whether to compress and significantly reduce the file size of the system anf core css files.

param.name: removeMootools
param.label: Remove Mootools and Caption javascript?
param.description: Select whether to remove mootools and caption javascript files from the frontend output. By setting this option to yes you can significantly reduce page load but please only disable this if you do not use any other scripts on the page that depend on mootools to function.

param.name: combinescripts
param.label: Combine core javascript files?
param.description: Select whether to load all Zen Grid javascripts into one file. Setting this option to yes negates any other setting regarding enabling the menu scripts etc and reduces the number of http requests made by the template.
param.option: Do not combine core framework javascript

param.name: removeJgen
param.label: Remove Joomla metatag generator?
param.description: This option removes the Joomla generator metatag from the website output. This can be used as a security consideration to remove an identifier marker that tells people that you are using Joomla.
